title: ds.security_event_episode_core_v1
description: Core security episode schema for MOVA: records a security-relevant event with policy reference, severity, and recommended/actual actions.

allOf.title: ds.mova_episode_core_v1
allOf.description: Core MOVA episode schema: minimal common structure for recording a meaningful step of work.

allOf.title: ds.mova_schema_core_v1
allOf.description: Core form for MOVA data schemas (ds.*) instances: common service fields schema_id, schema_version, meta, ext.

schema_id.description: Canonical schema id for this data record, e.g. ds.smartlink_config_v1. Recommended but optional.

schema_version.description: Version of the schema used when this record was produced, e.g. 1 or 1.0.0.

meta.description: Human- and operator-oriented metadata: title, description, tags, notes. Must not contain execution instructions for LLMs.

title.description: Short human-readable title of this record.

tags.description: Optional list of tags for searching and grouping.

lang.description: IETF language tag describing primary human language of title/description, e.g. uk, en, de.

ext.description: Machine-oriented extensions: technical flags, computed hints, links to external systems. Must not contain LLM instructions.

episode_id.description: Unique identifier of this episode, e.g. UUID or composite id.

episode_type.description: Logical type of the episode, e.g. file_cleanup_plan_review, smartlink_routing_decision.

mova_version.description: MOVA language version used when recording this episode, e.g. 4.1.1.

recorded_at.description: Timestamp when the episode record was created.

started_at.description: Optional timestamp when execution of this episode started.

finished_at.description: Optional timestamp when execution of this episode finished.

input_envelopes.description: References to envelopes (env.*) that served as inputs for this episode.

envelope_id.description: Identifier of a concrete envelope instance, if applicable.

input_data_refs.description: References to key data records (ds.*) that form the context of this episode.

data_type.description: Canonical data type id, e.g. ds.file_cleanup_snapshot_v1.

data_id.description: Identifier of a concrete data record.

executor.description: Description of who or what executed this episode.

role.description: Executor role, preferably from global.roles (e.g. agent, service, user).

executor_id.description: Identifier of the executor (user id, service name, agent id, etc.).

executor_kind.description: High-level executor kind, e.g. human, service, ai_model, tool.

environment.description: Technical environment and version information for this executor.

result_status.description: Status of the episode result. Should align with global.statuses.*.

result_summary.description: Short human-readable summary of what happened in this episode.

result_details.description: Optional structured details about the result: metrics, quality ratings, explanations.

output_data_refs.description: References to new or changed data records (ds.*) produced by this episode.

data_type.description: Canonical data type id, e.g. ds.file_cleanup_plan_v1.

data_id.description: Identifier of a concrete data record.

meta_episode.description: Optional episode-specific metadata: correlation ids, traces, links to logs. Must not contain LLM instructions.

episode_type.description: Episode type must indicate a security event. Convention: security_event[/subtype], where subtype normally matches a security_event_type id.

security_event_type.description: Concrete type of security event. Should use an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_event_type[*].id (e.g. prompt_injection_suspected), or a namespaced custom type (vendorX:custom_event) if extended.

security_event_category.description: High-level category for grouping security events.

severity.description: Severity of the event from the security perspective.

policy_profile_id.description: Identifier of the security policy profile that applies, e.g. mova_security_default_v1. Should match an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_policy_profile[*].id.

policy_ref.description: Optional reference to the concrete policy document/rule that was triggered.

policy_document_id.description: Identifier or URL of the policy document.

rule_id.description: Identifier of the concrete rule or clause inside the policy.

policy_version.description: Version of the policy used for this evaluation.

security_model_version.description: Version of the MOVA security model used when producing this episode, e.g. 1.0.0. Should match the security_model_version of the referenced policy profile in global.security_catalog_v1.

detection_source.description: Where this security event came from: human_review, rule_engine, runtime_guard, external_system, other.

detection_confidence.description: Confidence in this event being correctly detected, from 0.0 to 1.0.

recommended_actions.description: List of recommended actions in response to this security event.

action_type.description: Type of recommended action, e.g. log, alert, block, fallback. Should use an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_action_type[*].id.

reason.description: Short human-readable explanation why this action is recommended.

actions_taken.description: List of actions that were actually taken in response to this security event.

action_type.description: Type of action taken. Should use an id from global.security_catalog_v1.security_action_type[*].id.

actor.description: Actor that executed the action (service id, user id, tool id, etc.).

details.description: Optional human-readable details about this action.
